name: ExecuteLoadRunnerProfessional
description: Execute LoadRunner Professional tests from file system
helpMarkDown: Execute LoadRunner Professional tests from file system
author: Micro Focus

inputs.name: SourcePath
inputs.label: Source path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path for the test or path for the folder that contains the tests.

inputs.name: ResultsDirectory
inputs.label: Results directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The directory where the test results are saved.

inputs.name: ControllerPollingInterval
inputs.label: Controller polling interval
inputs.helpMarkDown: Polling interval for checking the scenario status, in seconds. The default is 30 seconds.

inputs.name: ScenarioExecutionTimeout
inputs.label: Scenario execution timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum time allotted for scenario execution, in minutes.

inputs.name: AnalysisTemplate
inputs.label: Analysis template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Apply a template for the build (path to a .tem file). Leave blank to use the default template.

inputs.name: TreatFailuresAsErrors
inputs.label: Treat failures as errors
inputs.helpMarkDown: When marked as true, if a test scenario fails, the task will be marked as failed.

inputs.name: TaskTimeout
inputs.label: Task timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: Timeout value for the task execution, in minutes. If this is empty, there will be no timeout for the task.

inputs.name: PublishScenarioResults
inputs.label: Publish scenario results
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is selected, the results will be available as a web application hosted by the agent used for the job. (IIS must be available on the agent.)

inputs.name: PublishArtifactsManually
inputs.label: Publish artifacts manually
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is not selected, the results will be uploaded automatically as build artifacts. If it is selected, you can choose to upload (or not) the results manually later. (See [Publish Build Artifacts task](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/utility/publish-build-artifacts?view=azure-devops))

inputs.name: BuildArtifactsDirectory
inputs.label: Build artifacts directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory used for build artifacts. The scenario results are stored here. This directory will not be cleaned (all the contained files will be not be deleted)

inputs.name: PublishTestReportsManually
inputs.label: Publish test reports manually
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is not selected, the tests reports will be published automatically. If it is selected, you can choose to publish (or not) them manually later. (See  [Publish Test Results task](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/test/publish-test-results?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml))

inputs.name: BuildTestReportsDirectory
inputs.label: Build test reports directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory used for reports. The scenario reports are stored here. This directory will not be cleaned (all the contained files will be not be deleted)
